title: Roots Torn Slow
lyrics:
Some folks leave like a gust through the pines,
Fast and loud, gone before the night’s decline.
But you left like roots ripped from the ground,
Slow and breakin’, didn’t make a sound.
I stood there watchin’, my heart in my hands,
Pieces of me scattered ‘cross this lonesome land.
(Pre-Chorus)
Every step feels like I’m circlin’ a scar,
A hollow where you were, where you tore me apart.
(Chorus)
Roots torn slow, they don’t just fade away,
They leave a hole that haunts me every day.
I walk like I’m growin’ ‘round the pain,
Plantin’ flowers in the dirt where you remained.
They bloom deeper, they know what I’ve lost,
They choose sunlight, no matter the cost.
(Verse 2)
I used to think love was a fire that burned,
But yours was a weight, a lesson I learned.
Each crack in my soul, it taught me to fight,
To find my own spark in the cold, endless night.
Now I’m sowin’ seeds where the shadows still creep,
Buildin’ a garden from the hurt runnin’ deep.
(Pre-Chorus)
Every bloom’s a battle, every petal’s a prayer,
Proof I’m still standin’, though you ain’t there.
(Chorus)
Roots torn slow, they don’t just fade away,
They leave a hole that haunts me every day.
I walk like I’m growin’ ‘round the pain,
Plantin’ flowers in the dirt where you remained.
They bloom deeper, they know what I’ve lost,
They choose sunlight, no matter the cost.
(Bridge)
I ain’t the girl you left in the dust,
My heart’s got thorns now, forged from the rust.
But these hands still dig, they still reach for the sky,
Turnin’ tears into roses that won’t ever die.
Your leavin’ broke me, but it made me whole,
I found my roots in this stubborn soul.
(Chorus)
Roots torn slow, they don’t just fade away,
They leave a hole that haunts me every day.
I walk like I’m growin’ ‘round the pain,
Plantin’ flowers in the dirt where you remained.
They bloom deeper, they know what I’ve lost,
They choose sunlight, no matter the cost.
(Outro)
Some leave like wind, but you left like stone,
Tore out my roots, but I’m growin’ my own.
These flowers I plant, they’re my heart’s quiet vow,
They bloom deeper… and I’m stronger now.
sounds_like_acoustic: The song is a mid-tempo country lament, blending traditional and modern elements, designed for a female vocalist with a powerful, emotive range
